ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My speaking, writing, and reading skills in the Vietnamese language. I am now able to write full length sentences and paragraphs in Vietnamese.
I learned to communicate more effectively and also how to better read, write, and understand Vietnamese texts. The lessons were relevant and all applicable to daily speaking.
Reading and writing Vietnamese alphabet, Vietnamese culture (food, family, weather, etc.), conversation
I learned how to read, write and listen to Vietnamese!

I was able to learn new vocabulary to speak about schooling, climate/weather, and people. The course also involved lessons on grammar and Vietnamese culture, as well as opportunities to learn about my classmates.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: the pacing of the course was perfect & the topics we had to speak/write/read about we're relevant. Weaknesses: deadlines were changed often/last minute a couple times, so it was difficult to keep important dates in check.
Very fun and engaging course. Instructor Quang is an expert in his field and makes each day enjoyable.

Strengths: Vietnamese heritage speakers will become more rooted in their culture and improve their Vietnamese speaking. Reading and writing skills are also developed and practiced regularly. A schedule is provided each week with assignments due and content to be covered in class. Weakness: Sometimes, the schedule isn't closely followed and it isn't clear which assignments are due and on what day.
Collaborate with students on the homework and get a tutor from the CTL! It makes the class more easy and fun
The class is taught by an engaging professor and benefits from his humor and energy. The class can be better structured and the assignments can benefit from more clarity and instruction.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to any heritage Vietnamese student wishing to improve their reading and writing skills in the Vietnamese language.
I would absolutely recommend this class to another student. You will improve your language-speaking ability and have a lot of fun while doing it. Incredible teacher.
Yes, especially if that student is Vietnamese and wishes to grow closer to their roots. Also a great way to improve Vietnamese vocabulary, and gain/enhance reading, writing, pronunciation.
I would recommend this class to anyone wanting to improve their Vietnamese.
